name: Light mode color map
description:
â€” Backstory

I first saw how-to theme apps at Yahoo, where we let our mail users customize the Ui in what felt like infinite ways. I then learned how-to at Mozilla when refreshing Pockets' light, dark, and sepia reading modes. Themes were around but not mainstream. Then iOS and Android hit us at the device level, and they went viral. 


Sadly, many products are still without dark mode, let alone multiple themes. If the functionality isn't already there, it can be tough to get buy-in from partners to build it now. 'The value isn't clear,' or as I've deduced, the pushback is often due to the crippling tech debt under the rug. Well, I thank Robinhood because they proved its value long ago.

 

The most tedious part of theme design is mapping the hex codes. After a couple of times, it's likely not something you'll want to do again. So, I created pre-mapped light and dark mode #Figma libraries that I can duplicate, give a quick brand refresh, and flip all my artboards back and forth between light and dark mode.
